definition: the relation of plants and living creatures to each other and to their environment; the study of this
the study of how a society organizes its money, trade and industry
the way in which money influences, or is organized within, an area of business or society
the relationship between production, trade and the supply of money in a particular country or region
a country, when you are thinking about its economic system
the use of resources in a way that avoids waste
offering good value for money
ways of saving money
a way of using as little of something as possible
the cheapest class of air travel
all the plants and living creatures in a particular area considered in relation to their physical environment
organized holidays that are designed so that the tourists damage the environment as little as possible, especially when some of the money they pay is used to protect the local environment and animals
the type or race of a plant or animal that has adapted to live in particular local conditions
a process of teaching, training and learning, especially in schools, colleges or universities, to improve knowledge and develop skills
a particular kind of teaching or training
the institutions or people involved in teaching and training
the subject of study that deals with how to teach
an interesting experience that teaches you something
a change that somebody/something causes in somebody/something else; a result
a particular look, sound or impression that somebody, such as an artist or a writer, wants to create
lights, sounds, special scenery, computer images, etc. used in a play or film, especially in order to show things that do not normally exist or happen
your personal possessions
to cause something to come into use
to come into use; to begin to apply
used when you are stating what the facts of a situation are
in use
to start to produce the results that are intended
to come into use; to begin to apply
used to show that you are giving the general meaning of what somebody has said or written rather than the exact words
producing a good, successful, dramatic, etc. result or impression
not producing the result you intend or hope for
starting from…
starting now
liquid waste, especially chemicals produced by factories, or sewage
a small oval object with a thin hard shell produced by a female bird and containing a young bird; a similar object (without a hard shell) produced by a female fish, insect, etc.
a bird’s egg, especially one from a chicken, that is eaten as food
a cell that combines with a sperm to create a baby or young animal
a situation in which it is difficult to tell which one of two things was the cause of the other
something that has some good parts and some bad ones
a person who you know will behave well/badly
to be made to look stupid
to destroy something that would make you rich, successful, etc.
to rely on one particular course of action for success rather than giving yourself several different possibilities
used to say that something is definitely true
to tell or show somebody how to do something that they can already do well, and probably better than you can
you cannot achieve something important without causing a few small problems
the quality that something has of being able to stretch and return to its original size and shape (= of being elastic)
a form of energy from charged elementary particles, usually supplied as electric current through cables, wires, etc. for lighting, heating, driving machines, etc.
a feeling of great emotion, excitement, etc.
the destruction of the roots of hairs by means of an electric current, as a beauty treatment
the process of separating a liquid (or electrolyte) into its chemical parts by passing an electric current through it
the branch of science and technology that studies electric currents in electronic equipment
the use of electronic technology, especially in developing new equipment
the electronic circuits and components (= parts) used in electronic equipment
the act of freeing somebody, especially from legal, political or social controls that limit what they can do
a young animal or plant in the very early stages of development before birth, or before coming out of its egg or seed, especially a human egg in the first eight weeks after fertilization
a thing at a very early stage of development
existing but not yet fully developed
the production or sending out of light, heat, gas, etc.
gas, etc. that is sent out into the air
work, especially when it is done to earn money; the state of being employed
the situation in which people have work
the act of employing somebody
the use of something
any mixture of liquids that do not normally mix together, such as oil and water
a type of paint used on walls and ceilings that dries without leaving a shiny surface
a substance on the surface of photographic film that makes it sensitive to light
the branch of medicine that is the study of the endocrine system and hormones
the strength, effort and enthusiasm required for physical or mental activity, work, etc.
the physical and mental effort that you use to do something
a source of power, such as fuel, used for driving machines, providing heat, etc.
the ability of matter or radiation to work because of its mass, movement, electric charge, etc.
a person who is full of energy and enthusiasm
the act of making people obey a particular law or rule
the act of improving the quality of something, often by adding something to it
the act of making somebody/something rich or richer
